title: A Dynamic View on Conscious and Unconscious Processes
descriptions:
The project "A Dynamic View on Conscious and Unconscious Processes" aims to address the fundamental issue of distinguishing between conscious and unconscious processes in the human mind. Using a combination of behavioral and brain imaging methods, the project will focus on three key tracks: unconscious perception utilizing Gaze-Contingent Substitution for subliminal stimuli presentation, conscious perception through a Bayesian framework for perceptual content reconstruction, and the maturation of consciousness in pre-verbal infants using psychophysical measures and high-density EEG.

The expected impact of this project includes uncovering sequential and complex forms of subliminal influences, specifying the cognitive mechanisms behind perceptual illusions, and providing new insights into the development of consciousness in humans. By utilizing cutting-edge techniques and focusing on various aspects of conscious and unconscious processes, this project has the potential to significantly contribute to our understanding of the human mind. The findings from this research have the potential to inform future studies in psychology, neuroscience, and cognitive science, ultimately advancing our knowledge of how consciousness evolves and functions.

By addressing these key objectives, this project has the potential to significantly advance our understanding of conscious and unconscious processes, ultimately contributing to the broader field of cognitive neuroscience.
